etymologies: mid 16th century; earliest use found in Proceedings of the Society of Antiquaries of Scotland. In some forms from Middle French, French canon cannon, extended use of canon tube, pipe

definitions: In plural. Tubular shaped extensions to men's trunk hose, designed to cover the lower thighs and knees, and to fill the gap between trunk hose and stockings, common in the 16th and 17th centuries. Also (especially in the 17th century): ornamental rolls or frills worn around the knees, either as the termination of stockings or attached to breeches.
